listItems.title: THE LAST THING HE TOLD ME
listItems.author: by Laura Dave
listItems.description: Hannah Hall discovers truths about her missing husband and bonds with his daughter from a previous relationship.

listItems.title: THE PRESIDENT'S DAUGHTER
listItems.author: by Bill Clinton and James Patterson
listItems.description: Matthew Keating, a past president and former Navy SEAL, goes on his own to find his abducted teenage daughter.

listItems.title: MALIBU RISING
listItems.author: by Taylor Jenkins Reid
listItems.description: An epic party has serious outcomes for four famous siblings.

listItems.title: WHERE THE CRAWDADS SING
listItems.author: by Delia Owens
listItems.description: In a quiet town on the North Carolina coast in 1969, a young woman who survived alone in the marsh becomes a murder suspect.

listItems.title: PEOPLE WE MEET ON VACATION
listItems.author: by Emily Henry
listItems.description: Opposites Poppy and Alex meet to vacation together one more time in hopes of saving their relationship.

listItems.title: THE MIDNIGHT LIBRARY
listItems.author: by Matt Haig
listItems.description: Nora Seed finds a library beyond the edge of the universe that contains books with multiple possibilities of the lives one could have lived.

listItems.title: GOLDEN GIRL
listItems.author: by Elin Hilderbrand
listItems.description: A Nantucket novelist gets one final summer to watch what happens from the great beyond.

listItems.title: IT ENDS WITH US
listItems.author: by Colleen Hoover
listItems.description: A battered wife raised in a violent home attempts to halt the cycle of abuse.

listItems.title: PROJECT HAIL MARY
listItems.author: by Andy Weir
listItems.description: Ryland Grace awakes from a long sleep alone and far from home, and the fate of humanity rests on his shoulders.

listItems.title: THE SONG OF ACHILLES
listItems.author: by Madeline Miller
listItems.description: A reimagining of Homer’s “Iliad” that is narrated by Achilles' companion Patroclus.

listItems.title: THE MAIDENS
listItems.author: by Alex Michaelides
listItems.description: A therapist suspects a Greek tragedy professor at Cambridge University of committing murder.

listItems.title: THE SEVEN HUSBANDS OF EVELYN HUGO
listItems.author: by Taylor Jenkins Reid
listItems.description: A movie icon recounts stories of her loves and career to a struggling magazine writer.

listItems.title: THE FOUR WINDS
listItems.author: by Kristin Hannah
listItems.description: As dust storms roll during the Great Depression, Elsa must choose between saving the family and farm or heading West.

listItems.title: THE SILENT PATIENT
listItems.author: by Alex Michaelides
listItems.description: Theo Faber looks into the mystery of a famous painter who stops speaking after shooting her husband.

listItems.title: BEACH READ
listItems.author: by Emily Henry
listItems.description: A relationship develops between a literary fiction author and a romance novelist as they both try to overcome writer’s block.

listItems.title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE
listItems.author: by Bessel van der Kolk
listItems.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.

listItems.title: KILLING THE MOB
listItems.author: by Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard
listItems.description: The 10th book in the conservative commentator’s Killing series looks at organized crime in the United States during the 20th century.

listItems.title: THE BOMBER MAFIA
listItems.author: by Malcolm Gladwell
listItems.description: A look at the key players and outcomes of precision bombing during World War II.

listItems.title: GREENLIGHTS
listItems.author: by Matthew McConaughey
listItems.description: The Academy Award-winning actor shares snippets from the diaries he kept over the last 35 years.

listItems.title: UNTAMED
listItems.author: by Glennon Doyle
listItems.description: The activist and public speaker describes her journey of listening to her inner voice.

listItems.title: CASTE
listItems.author: by Isabel Wilkerson
listItems.description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist examines aspects of caste systems across civilizations and reveals a rigid hierarchy in America today.

listItems.title: THE PREMONITION
listItems.author: by Michael Lewis
listItems.description: Stories of skeptics who went against the official response of the Trump administration to the outbreak of Covid-19. The profiles include a local public-health officer and a group of doctors nicknamed the Wolverines.

listItems.title: CRYING IN H MART
listItems.author: by Michelle Zauner
listItems.description: The daughter of a Korean mother and Jewish-American father, and leader of the indie rock project Japanese Breakfast, describes creating her own identity after losing her mother to cancer.

listItems.title: BRAIDING SWEETGRASS
listItems.author: by Robin Wall Kimmerer
listItems.description: A botanist and member of the Citizen Potawatomi Nation espouses having an understanding and appreciation of plants and animals.

listItems.title: THE ANTHROPOCENE REVIEWED
listItems.author: by John Green
listItems.description: A collection of personal essays that review different facets of the human-centered planet.

listItems.title: HOW THE WORD IS PASSED
listItems.author: by Clint Smith
listItems.description: A staff writer at The Atlantic explores the legacy of slavery and its imprint on centuries of American history.

listItems.title: WHAT HAPPENED TO YOU?
listItems.author: by Bruce D. Perry and Oprah Winfrey
listItems.description: An approach to dealing with trauma that shifts an essential question used to investigate it.

listItems.title: BORN A CRIME
listItems.author: by Trevor Noah
listItems.description: A memoir about growing up biracial in apartheid South Africa by the host of “The Daily Show.”

listItems.title: THINK AGAIN
listItems.author: by Adam Grant
listItems.description: An examination of the cognitive skills of rethinking and unlearning that could be used to adapt to a rapidly changing world.

listItems.title: ON JUNETEENTH
listItems.author: by Annette Gordon-Reed
listItems.description: The Pulitzer Prize winner weaves together American history with personal memoir to show the importance of events in Galveston, Texas, on June 19, 1865.

listItems.title: THE PRESIDENT'S DAUGHTER
listItems.author: by Bill Clinton and James Patterson
listItems.description: Matthew Keating, a past president and former Navy SEAL, goes on his own to find his abducted teenage daughter.

listItems.author: by Laura Dave
listItems.description: Hannah Hall discovers truths about her missing husband and bonds with his daughter from a previous relationship.

listItems.author: by Taylor Jenkins Reid
listItems.description: An epic party has serious outcomes for four famous siblings.

listItems.title: THE MIDNIGHT LIBRARY
listItems.author: by Matt Haig
listItems.description: Nora Seed finds a library beyond the edge of the universe that contains books with multiple possibilities of the lives one could have lived.

listItems.title: GOLDEN GIRL
listItems.author: by Elin Hilderbrand
listItems.description: A Nantucket novelist gets one final summer to watch what happens from the great beyond.

listItems.title: THE MAIDENS
listItems.author: by Alex Michaelides
listItems.description: A therapist suspects a Greek tragedy professor at Cambridge University of committing murder.

listItems.title: SOOLEY
listItems.author: by John Grisham
listItems.description: Samuel Sooleymon receives a basketball scholarship to North Carolina Central and determines to bring his family over from a civil war-ravaged South Sudan.

listItems.title: PROJECT HAIL MARY
listItems.author: by Andy Weir
listItems.description: Ryland Grace awakes from a long sleep alone and far from home, and the fate of humanity rests on his shoulders.

listItems.title: THE FOUR WINDS
listItems.author: by Kristin Hannah
listItems.description: As dust storms roll during the Great Depression, Elsa must choose between saving the family and farm or heading West.

listItems.title: THE OTHER BLACK GIRL
listItems.author: by Zakiya Dalila Harris
listItems.description: Tension unfurls when two young Black women meet against the starkly white backdrop of New York City book publishing.

listItems.title: THE INVISIBLE LIFE OF ADDIE LARUE
listItems.author: by V.E. Schwab
listItems.description: A Faustian bargain comes with a curse that affects the adventure Addie LaRue has across centuries.

listItems.title: THE HILL WE CLIMB
listItems.author: by Amanda Gorman
listItems.description: The poem read on President Joe Biden's Inauguration Day, by the youngest poet to write and perform an inaugural poem.

listItems.title: THE VANISHING HALF
listItems.author: by Brit Bennett
listItems.description: The lives of twin sisters who run away from a Southern Black community at age 16 diverge as one returns and the other takes on a different racial identity but their fates intertwine.

listItems.title: THE SWEETNESS OF WATER
listItems.author: by Nathan Harris
listItems.description: Two brothers freed by the Emancipation Proclamation hope to reunite with their mother while the forbidden romance between two Confederate soldiers causes chaos.

listItems.title: TOM CLANCY: TARGET ACQUIRED
listItems.author: by Don Bentley
listItems.description: A cushy assignment to help the C.I.A. puts Jack Ryan Jr. in the sights of trained killers.

listItems.title: KILLING THE MOB
listItems.author: by Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard
listItems.description: The 10th book in the conservative commentator’s Killing series looks at organized crime in the United States during the 20th century.

listItems.description: A look at the key players and outcomes of precision bombing during World War II.

listItems.description: The daughter of a Korean mother and Jewish-American father, and leader of the indie rock project Japanese Breakfast, describes creating her own identity after losing her mother to cancer.

listItems.description: A collection of personal essays that review different facets of the human-centered planet.

listItems.description: A staff writer at The Atlantic explores the legacy of slavery and its imprint on centuries of American history.

listItems.description: An examination of the cognitive skills of rethinking and unlearning that could be used to adapt to a rapidly changing world.

listItems.title: ON JUNETEENTH
listItems.author: by Annette Gordon-Reed
listItems.description: The Pulitzer Prize winner weaves together American history with personal memoir to show the importance of events in Galveston, Texas, on June 19, 1865.

listItems.title: SOMEBODY'S DAUGHTER
listItems.author: by Ashley C. Ford
listItems.description: A memoir about growing up a poor Black girl in Indiana with a family fragmented by incarceration.

listItems.title: NOISE
listItems.author: by Daniel Kahneman, Olivier Sibony and Cass R. Sunstein
listItems.description: What might cause variability in judgments that should be identical and potential ways to remedy this.

listItems.title: HOW TO BE AN ANTIRACIST
listItems.author: by Ibram X. Kendi
listItems.description: A primer for creating a more just and equitable society through identifying and opposing racism.

listItems.title: WHERE THE CRAWDADS SING
listItems.author: by Delia Owens
listItems.description: In a quiet town on the North Carolina coast in 1969, a young woman who survived alone in the marsh becomes a murder suspect.

listItems.title: PEOPLE WE MEET ON VACATION
listItems.author: by Emily Henry
listItems.description: Opposites Poppy and Alex meet to vacation together one more time in hopes of saving their relationship.

listItems.title: THE SONG OF ACHILLES
listItems.author: by Madeline Miller
listItems.description: A reimagining of Homer’s “Iliad” that is narrated by Achilles' companion Patroclus.

listItems.title: IT ENDS WITH US
listItems.author: by Colleen Hoover
listItems.description: A battered wife raised in a violent home attempts to halt the cycle of abuse.

listItems.title: THE SEVEN HUSBANDS OF EVELYN HUGO
listItems.author: by Taylor Jenkins Reid
listItems.description: A movie icon recounts stories of her loves and career to a struggling magazine writer.

listItems.title: THE SILENT PATIENT
listItems.author: by Alex Michaelides
listItems.description: Theo Faber looks into the mystery of a famous painter who stops speaking after shooting her husband.

listItems.title: BEACH READ
listItems.author: by Emily Henry
listItems.description: A relationship develops between a literary fiction author and a romance novelist as they both try to overcome writer’s block.

listItems.title: ONE LAST STOP
listItems.author: by Casey McQuiston
listItems.description: August meets the girl of her dreams on a New York subway only to find she’s from another time.

listItems.title: THE UNHONEYMOONERS
listItems.author: by Christina Lauren
listItems.description: When food poisoning spoils a wedding, Olive Torres goes with the best man — who is also her nemesis — on her twin sister’s honeymoon.

listItems.title: RED, WHITE AND ROYAL BLUE
listItems.author: by Casey McQuiston
listItems.description: A staged friendship between the son of the president and his rival, the Prince of Wales, evolves into a secret and potentially dangerous romance.

listItems.title: FREED
listItems.author: by E.L. James
listItems.description: The final chapter of the Fifty Shades as Told by Christian trilogy delves into the wedding between Christian Grey and Anastasia Steele.

listItems.title: CIRCE
listItems.author: by Madeline Miller
listItems.description: Zeus banishes Helios' daughter to an island, where she must choose between living with gods or mortals.

listItems.title: IF IT BLEEDS
listItems.author: by Stephen King
listItems.description: Four novellas: “Mr. Harrigan’s Phone,” “The Life of Chuck,” “Rat” and “If It Bleeds.”

listItems.title: THE HOUSE IN THE CERULEAN SEA
listItems.author: by T.J. Klune
listItems.description: Linus Baker is sent to the Marsyas Island Orphanage to assess whether six children in different forms might cause the end of days.

listItems.title: MEXICAN GOTHIC
listItems.author: by Silvia Moreno-Garcia
listItems.description: In 1950s Mexico, a debutante travels to a distant mansion where family secrets of a faded mining empire have been kept hidden.

listItems.title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE
listItems.author: by Bessel van der Kolk
listItems.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.

listItems.title: BRAIDING SWEETGRASS
listItems.author: by Robin Wall Kimmerer
listItems.description: A botanist and member of the Citizen Potawatomi Nation espouses having an understanding and appreciation of plants and animals.

listItems.title: BORN A CRIME
listItems.author: by Trevor Noah
listItems.description: A memoir about growing up biracial in apartheid South Africa by the host of “The Daily Show.”

listItems.title: SAPIENS
listItems.author: by Yuval Noah Harari
listItems.description: How Homo sapiens became Earth’s dominant species.

listItems.title: WHITE FRAGILITY
listItems.author: by Robin DiAngelo
listItems.description: Historical and cultural analyses on what causes defensive moves by white people and how this inhibits cross-racial dialogue.

listItems.title: JUST MERCY
listItems.author: by Bryan Stevenson
listItems.description: A civil rights lawyer and MacArthur grant recipient’s memoir of his decades of work to free innocent people condemned to death.

listItems.title: THE GLASS CASTLE
listItems.author: by Jeannette Walls
listItems.description: The author recalls how she and her siblings were constantly moved from one bleak place to another.

listItems.title: KILLERS OF THE FLOWER MOON
listItems.author: by David Grann
listItems.description: The story of a murder spree in 1920s Oklahoma that targeted Osage Indians, whose lands contained oil. The fledgling F.B.I. intervened, ineffectively.

listItems.title: OUTLIERS
listItems.author: by Malcolm Gladwell
listItems.description: Unexpected factors that explain why some people succeed, such as upbringing, timing and 10,000 hours of deliberate practice.

listItems.title: THINKING, FAST AND SLOW
listItems.author: by Daniel Kahneman
listItems.description: When we can and cannot trust our intuitions in making business and personal decisions.

listItems.title: BECOMING
listItems.author: by Michelle Obama
listItems.description: The former first lady describes her journey from the South Side of Chicago to the White House, and how she balanced work, family and her husband’s political ascent.

listItems.title: COUNTDOWN 1945
listItems.author: by Chris Wallace with Mitch Weiss
listItems.description: The Fox News Sunday anchor gives an account of the key people involved in and events leading up to America’s attack on Hiroshima in 1945.

listItems.title: MY GRANDMOTHER'S HANDS
listItems.author: by Resmaa Menakem
listItems.description: A therapist who specializes in trauma, body-centered psychotherapy and violence prevention explains racism's effect on the body.

listItems.title: GRIT
listItems.author: by Angela Duckworth
listItems.description: The MacArthur Fellow argues that passion and perseverance are more important than innate talent in creating success.

listItems.title: THE OTHER WES MOORE
listItems.author: by Wes Moore
listItems.description: A tale of two Wes Moores: the author, a Rhodes scholar; the other, a man in prison.

listItems.title: THE BOY, THE MOLE, THE FOX AND THE HORSE
listItems.author: by Charlie Mackesy

listItems.title: WORLD TRAVEL
listItems.author: by Anthony Bourdain and Laurie Woolever

listItems.title: THE SUBTLE ART OF NOT GIVING A F*CK
listItems.author: by Mark Manson

listItems.title: THE WOMEN OF THE BIBLE SPEAK
listItems.author: by Shannon Bream

listItems.title: WONDER
listItems.author: by R.J. Palacio
listItems.description: A boy with a facial deformity starts school.

listItems.title: REFUGEE
listItems.author: by Alan Gratz
listItems.description: Three children in three different conflicts look for safe haven.

listItems.title: STAMPED (FOR KIDS)
listItems.author: by Jason Reynolds, Ibram X. Kendi and Sonja Cherry-Paul
listItems.description: An adaptation of "Stamped" for younger readers.

listItems.title: DUDE PERFECT 101 TRICKS, TIPS, AND COOL STUFF
listItems.author: by  Dude Perfect with Travis Thrasher
listItems.description: Step-by-step instructions to do your own trick shots.

listItems.title: THE ICKABOG
listItems.author: by J.K. Rowling
listItems.description: A fearsome monster threatens the kingdom of Cornucopia.

listItems.title: THE ONE AND ONLY BOB
listItems.author: by Katherine Applegate. Illustrated by Patricia Castelao
listItems.description: In this sequel to "The One and Only Ivan," Bob sets out on a dangerous journey in search of his long-lost sister.

listItems.title: AMARI AND THE NIGHT BROTHERS
listItems.author: by B.B. Alston
listItems.description: Amari Peters competes for a spot at the Bureau of Supernatural Affairs.

listItems.title: THE GAME MASTER: SUMMER SCHOOLED
listItems.author: by Matt and Rebecca Zamolo
listItems.description: Rebecca Zamolo takes on the Game Master, who threatens to ruin summer.

listItems.title: BEST NERDS FOREVER
listItems.author: by James Patterson and Chris Grabenstein
listItems.description: As a ghost, Finn attempts to solve his own murder.

listItems.title: GROUND ZERO
listItems.author: by Alan Gratz
listItems.description: Parallel storylines of Brandon and Reshmina take place on Sept. 11th, in 2001 and 2019.

listItems.title: TIME FOR SCHOOL, LITTLE BLUE TRUCK
listItems.author: by Alice Schertle. Illustrated by Jill McElmurry
listItems.description: Blue gives a friend a ride to school.

listItems.title: THE BENCH
listItems.author: by Meghan, the Duchess of Sussex. Illustrated by Christian Robinson
listItems.description: The special relationship between father and son.

listItems.title: WHAT IS GOD LIKE?
listItems.author: by Rachel Held Evans and Matthew Paul Turner. Illustrated by Ying Hui Tan
listItems.description: Exploring the attributes of God.

listItems.title: THE WONDERFUL THINGS YOU WILL BE
listItems.author: by Emily Winfield Martin
listItems.description: A celebration of future possibilities.

listItems.title: DRAGONS LOVE TACOS
listItems.author: by Adam Rubin. Illustrated by Daniel Salmieri
listItems.description: What to serve your dragon-guests.

listItems.title: THE DAY THE CRAYONS QUIT
listItems.author: by Drew Daywalt. Illustrated by Oliver Jeffers
listItems.description: Problems arise when Duncan’s crayons revolt.

listItems.title: GRUMPY MONKEY
listItems.author: by Suzanne Lang. Illustrated by Max Lang
listItems.description: Jim Panzee is having a bad day.

listItems.title: AN ELEPHANT AND PIGGIE BIGGIE!
listItems.author: by Mo Willems
listItems.description: An anthology combines five of Gerald and Piggie's adventures.

listItems.title: I WISH YOU MORE
listItems.author: by Amy Krouse Rosenthal. Illustrated by Tom Lichtenheld
listItems.description: A bounty of good wishes.

listItems.title: WE ARE WATER PROTECTORS
listItems.author: by Carole Lindstrom. Illustrated by Michaela Goade
listItems.description: Standing up for environmental justice.

listItems.title: SHADOW AND BONE TRILOGY
listItems.author: by Leigh Bardugo
listItems.description: The basis of the Netflix series; previously titled "The Grisha Trilogy."

listItems.title: DIARY OF A WIMPY KID
listItems.author: written and illustrated by Jeff Kinney
listItems.description: The travails and challenges of adolescence.

listItems.title: HARRY POTTER
listItems.author: by J.K. Rowling
listItems.description: A wizard hones his conjuring skills in the service of fighting evil.

listItems.title: PERCY JACKSON & THE OLYMPIANS
listItems.author: by Rick Riordan
listItems.description: A boy battles mythological monsters.

listItems.title: AWESOME FRIENDLY KID
listItems.author: written and illustrated by Jeff Kinney
listItems.description: Rowley Jefferson chronicles his life story and adventures.

listItems.title: WINGS OF FIRE
listItems.author: by Tui T. Sutherland
listItems.description: Only the five dragonets of destiny can unite the seven warring dragon tribes.

listItems.title: MAGIC TREE HOUSE
listItems.author: by Mary Pope Osborne. Illustrated by Sal Murdocca
listItems.description: These siblings can overcome space and time.

listItems.title: CAPTAIN UNDERPANTS
listItems.author: written and illustrated by Dav Pilkey
listItems.description: Boys and their principal fight evil.

listItems.title: THE LAST KIDS ON EARTH
listItems.author: by Max Brallier. Illustrated by Douglas Holgate
listItems.description: Jack and his friends fight for their lives through the zombie apocalypse.

listItems.title: I SURVIVED
listItems.author: by Lauren Tarshis
listItems.description: Youngsters' tales of living through dangerous historical events.

listItems.title: THE HATE U GIVE
listItems.author: by Angie Thomas
listItems.description: A 16-year-old girl sees a police officer kill her friend.

listItems.title: ONE OF US IS LYING
listItems.author: by Karen M. McManus
listItems.description: For five students, a detour into detention ends in murder.

listItems.title: FIREKEEPER'S DAUGHTER
listItems.author: by Angeline Boulley
listItems.description: Daunis investigates a deadly new drug being distributed in her tribal community.

listItems.title: ACE OF SPADES
listItems.author: by Faridah Abike-Iyimide
listItems.description: An anonymous texter known as Aces reveals secrets about an elite private school’s only two Black students.

listItems.title: BLACKOUT
listItems.author: by Dhonielle Clayton. et al
listItems.description: A collection of interconnected stories of Black teen love.

listItems.title: LORE
listItems.author: by Alexandra Bracken
listItems.description: To get revenge for her family’s murder, Lore must re-enter a hunt know as the Agon.

listItems.title: THE INHERITANCE GAMES
listItems.author: by Jennifer Lynn Barnes
listItems.description: Avery Grambs must solve a multilayered puzzle to find out why she’s the recipient of a billionaire’s inheritance.

listItems.title: REALM BREAKER
listItems.author: by Victoria Aveyard
listItems.description: A small band of misfits attempt to save Allward.

listItems.title: STAMPED
listItems.author: by Jason Reynolds and Ibram X. Kendi
listItems.description: An exploration of racism and antiracism in America.

listItems.title: RULE OF WOLVES
listItems.author: by Leigh Bardugo
listItems.description: The second book in the King of Scars duology.
